definition: to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Zoom out and space and time play equal parts, in line with Lorentz symmetry.
sentences.chinese: 缩小时空间和时间平分秋色，与洛伦兹对称相一致。

sentences.english: Without that goal the two Milanese teams would be tied.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有那粒进球，两支米兰球队将平分秋色。

sentences.english: The OpenSSL performance was identical between the two systems.
sentences.chinese: 两个系统中的OpenSSL性能平分秋色。

sentences.english: "It was a decent enough draw, " said the vice-captain.
sentences.chinese: 副队长说，双方都踢得平分秋色。

definition: lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
leeward/downwind/disadvantageous position/to concede or give way in an argument
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
on the up/currently winning/rising (in popularity etc)
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
